fields.description:
Change some documentation links in the JIRA Studio and Confluence Hosted doc spaces on CAC, because of the upcoming Confluence 2.8 release. This is not a big task :) but needs to be coordinated with the Confluence 2.8 docs.

When?
* Tuesday 25 March. (We plan to declare the Confluence DOC space a 2.8 beta on Tuesday 25 March.)

Reason:
* When Confluence 2.8 is released, the new Confluence UI will be quite different from the 2.8 UI.
* This means that the Confluence docs (in space DOC on CAC) will reflect the new UI.
* But the Hosted products will not migrate to Confluence 2.8 for a while.
* The docs for Studio and Hosted contain summary/overview pages and then link to the main Confluence docs for further information. Currently, these links all point to the DOC space.

To do:
* Change the links on the JIRASTUDIO Home page (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO) and on any other affected pages in the User Guide etc: Instead of pointing to the DOC space, they should point to the CONF27 space.
* Our ALLDOCS space (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ALLDOCS) must guide the Hosted and Studio users to download the 2.7 docs not the 2.8 docs. (PDF, XML and HTML versions.)

NOTE: Space CONF27 already exists but is currently hidden. Will unveil when DOC space goes to 2.8 beta.
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF27
fields.summary: Change JIRASTUDIO documentation links to point to archive CONF27 space

fields.description:
Please would you create a "Documentation" component in the following two projects on studio.atlassian.com:
* JIRA Studio - component lead = Andrew Lui
* Confluence Hosted - component lead = Sarah Maddox
fields.summary: Add "Documentation" component to JIRA Studio and Confluence Hosted projects on studio.atlassian.com

fields.description: The message added above the Fisheye change log says "You may check out a source code by running..." -- it should say "You may check out *the* source code" (or perhaps 'this source code'.
fields.summary: Ungrammatical message in Fisheye

fields.description: Out the box, Studio does not show the "Attachment" field on the "Create issue" screen. While this can be done by going to Administration -> Field Configurations -> Default Field Configuration, and unhiding the attachment field, I think we should do it for users by default - just about everyone will find it useful, and not many will know how to enable it.
fields.summary: Allow attachments on Create Issue screen by default

fields.description:
Unless I'm missing something, there is no way for users to edit their Confluence user profile / preferences:

!confprofile_1.png!

This can be accessed by adding /wiki/users/editmyprofile.action to the base URL.

Notably, users cannot adjust whether they get notified of their own changes to Confluence pages. They also cannot adjust their timezone (not sure of the significance of that), cannot see the overview of their watches, labels and drafts.
fields.summary: No way to change Confluence user preferences
Submenu for Fisheye and Crucible should not be visible when user is not logged in
Clicking on Issues tab when user is not logged in will try to display list of the projects.

fields.description: See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOVER/Clover-for-Maven+2+User%27s+Guide and http://svn.atlassian.com/fisheye/viewrep/public/contrib/clover/maven-clover-plugin/trunk/src/main/resources/clover.license
fields.summary: Enable Clover for our builds

fields.description:
This should be broken up into multiple tickets for implementation. High level:
* 'add photo' from JIRA user profile prompts you to add a photo that is saved in the Confluence user profile
* that url is stored in Crowd as a user attribute
* photo displayed on JIRA issues and comments for now
* later will be including in Stream, potentially Fisheye/Crucible
fields.summary: Confluence user photo available suite-wide

fields.description:
Should be:
* available as a webform
* ideally stored somewhere other than the same data center as JIRA Studio
* feeds Twitter and jira.com/status
* long-term will feed the customer notification bar
fields.summary: Add 'Studio Status' service

fields.description: Pops up sometimes, quite annoying.
fields.summary: Remove feedback bar completely from code

fields.description: linking to www.jira.com/status. Page should be up by Thurs 20 March
fields.summary: Add 'Status' link to footer

fields.description: When (yes, I said when) Contegix's data-centre gets hit by a freak locust plague and goes offline, our primary vehicle for communicating with our customers MUST still be available. This means different hosting provider, different data centre and geographically redundant DNS.
fields.summary: The studio blog should not be co-located with Studio itself.

fields.description: Review was: https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-CLOV-8
fields.summary: Errors while expanding cru revision diffs are "sorry mate"ing the whole page

fields.description:
On every page load, the feedback form (see studio-theme/studio-theme-static-plugin/src/main/resources/studio/js/split_button.js line 138) flickers on and off at the bottom of the page, which is rather annoying.

I'm running Firefox 2.0.0.10 on a 3.2Ghz Xeon.
fields.summary: Feedback form flickers into visibility on page load

fields.description:
Say I go to the [Studio admin page|http://test.jira.com/secure/admin/StudioAdministration.jspa], click "change" under the logo and enter an absolute path, eg. to http://www.atlassian.com/images/dude.png. 

The logo image then works in JIRA, but breaks in Conflence, Fisheye and Crucible. The image URL in these 3 cases is:

http://test.jira.com/..http://www.atlassian.com/images/dude.png
fields.summary: Absolute studio logos break in Confluence, fisheye, crucible

{noformat}

The attachment path was correctly set (last file written 12 March) until this most recent upgrade, so it seems the upgrade tasks are running again, breaking the legitimate attachment path on every upgrade.
fields.summary: Upgrade task to enable attachments runs on every upgrade

fields.description: On hover the menu displays the background in blue and the text in a slightly darker blue. The text should either be even darker or white to provide better readability.
fields.summary: Menu hover contrast between text and background not strong enough

fields.description: The hover effect was lost on the actions menu which makes it hard to detect the split button functionality.
fields.summary: Action menu in studio lost hover effect

fields.description:
- Log in to Jira studio and click around thru projects
- Log out and click on Wiki/Source/Reviews tabs - you will see list of recent projects in a dropdown
fields.summary: Recent projects list is visble for '"log-out-ed" users in Confluence, Fisheye and Crucible

fields.description: A bar where the feedback bar used to be, in a less obnxious color, which updates with alerts that we send out. Possibly thru Twitter? Customer able to exit from maintenance bar, only appears again next time there's maintenance. Also look at potentially using with Confluence Hosted (replacing Collapsible RSS portlet).
fields.summary: maintenance notification bar

fields.summary: NPE at https://studio.atlassian.com/secure/admin/StudioAdministration.jspa

fields.description: In studio.atlassian.com, there is an invalid group name with use permissions that causes an NPE in our Studio Administration.  We need defensive coding to prevent the stacktrace to the user
fields.summary: Check for invalid group name with use permissions

fields.description: Upgrade task to add a crucible applink from a fisheye link
fields.summary: Add revews tab if not found

fields.description:
Briefly discussed with Michael and Don: if we enabled SOAP access for JIRA/Confluence, that would allow the more enterprising customers to automated the import of their own data, or use [swizzle|http://swizzle.codehaus.org/] to export their data, generate periodic reports, etc.

It appears that we have RPC access disabled for JIRA and Confluence currently (looking at test.jira.com).
fields.summary: Enable RPC by default for JIRA, Confluence

fields.description:
We're aiming to allow customers to reply to JIRA notifications, and have their replies added automatically as comments. This raises a question: what should we do when the commenter's email address doesn't match a user in JIRA already?

The simplest option is to automatically create a user for them (createusers=true parameter). However if we're billing per user, customers might not want that.

Probably we need to bounce the email back to the sender, with an explanation and instructions to contact the Studio admin.  This would require some new functionality added to the JIRA FileService.

A variation on this is to bounce the email directly to the Studio admin. This would require porting MailServer's 'forwardEmail' support to FileService, and somehow arranging for the forwardEmail parameter value to be set.
fields.summary: Handling of notification replies from non-registered users.

fields.description:
Either in the sample data we provide, or in an upgrade task (for existing customers), we need to configure a FileService to parse emails containing replies to notifications, and convert them into comments. The service should look like this:

!commentfromemailservice.png!
fields.summary: Create a JIRA service to add comments from emails

fields.description:
To reproduce, you need 2 users:
login as A.
Visit a confluence page.
logout.
login as B.
Visit a confluence page again.
A's name appears, and you have access to all of A's magical powers and permissions.

If you visit a wiki page before logging back in, then when you do log back in, you get the correct behaviour.
fields.summary: Wiki logout/login is buggered

fields.description:
Currently it's very difficult to a user like me, to know which JIRA Studio version I am actually using.

Probably having footer like:

Powered by JIRA Studio X.Y.Z (similar to JIRA and other products)

would make sense.
fields.summary: JIRA Studio should show in some clear place (footer?) its version

fields.description:
To reproduce I used IE 7 (In FF 2.0.11 it was much difficult to reproduce, but once I saw it):
- log out from Studio
- clear all your private date (auth tokens, cache, etc)
- *restart* browser (restarting is necessary as Log Out really does not work well) - at least with IE 7
- try to access e.g. the following URL: https://studio.atlassian.com/fisheye/browse/FE/branches/iteration02/src/java/com/cenqua/crucible/hibernate/HibernateUtil.java?r=7765
- you should see something similar like in the attached file (please make sure that you still see "Log In" there, as it happens only when you are not logged in)

Cheers,

Wojtek
